job.title: Software Engineer (Entry Level)
job.description: <p><u>Position Description:</u></p><p><br></p><p>As a Software Engineer you will be trained to develop information systems by designing, developing, and installing software solutions to the world class clients we serve.&nbsp;Campus hires begin their careers with TCS in the Initial Learning Program.&nbsp;A fully paid training program designed to provide you with the information and training necessary to succeed at TCS and excel at client sites.&nbsp;However the learning does not stop there! TCS is committed to the continuous growth of its associates, in line with the core value of Learning &amp; Sharing.&nbsp;We offer a Continuous Learning Program that spans technologies, domains, processes and soft skills.&nbsp;In addition, TCS associates are encouraged to undertake certifications and accreditations in a wide range of subject areas.&nbsp;With clients located across the US and globe, TCS can offer great flexibility in work location, excellent career advancement, and a variety of opportunities. TCS’ mentoring, career development, and on-the-job training ensure a smooth transition into your professional life and orient you to our culture, values, vision, and mission.</p><p><br></p><p>Role: Entry Level Software Developer</p><p>Location: New Jersey Hub - (NJ/DE/MD/NY/PA/CT/RI/VA/MA/D.C/NH)</p><p>Job Type: Full Time /Permanent</p><p><br></p><p>Responsibilities:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Develop, create, and modify general computer application software or specialized programs&nbsp;</li><li>Analyze user needs and develop software solutions&nbsp;</li><li>Design or customize software for client use to optimize operational efficiency&nbsp;</li><li>Improve existing systems by analyzing areas of modification&nbsp;</li><li>Analyze and design databases with application areas&nbsp;</li><li>Coordinate database development with a team or individually&nbsp;</li><li>Maintain systems by monitoring, identifying, and correcting software defects&nbsp;</li><li>Create technical specifications and test plans&nbsp;</li><li>Update knowledge and skills regularly through in-house and external courses, manuals, and new applications</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Requirements:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>B.S/MS in Computer Science (CS), Information Technology (IT Computer Engineering (CE), Informatics, or Software Engineering (SE)&nbsp;</li><li>Knowledge of basic computer science concepts, programming, and Information Systems&nbsp;</li><li>Interest and willingness to travel and relocate&nbsp;</li><li>Knowledge in Java/J2EE Development, C++/C#, .NET</li><li>The graduation date should be Aug 2020 - Sept 2021.</li></ul>
